gov.usgs.earthquake.nshmp.gmm

Class BcHydro_2012

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.earthquake.nshmp.gmm.BcHydro_2012
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GroundMotionModel

    public abstract class BcHydro_2012
extends Object
implements GroundMotionModel
    Abstract implementation of the subduction ground motion model created for BC Hydro, Canada, by Addo, Abrahamson, & Youngs (2012). An update to this implementation is documented in Abrahamson, Gregor, & Addo (2016). This model supports both slab and interface type events.

    Note: Direct instantiation of GroundMotionModels is prohibited. Use Gmm.instance(Imt) to retrieve an instance for a desired Imt.

    Changes due to Abrahamson et al. (2016) update:

    • Added coefficients for 0.02s that are identical to PGA. 0.02s ground motions had previously had been computed via interpolation between 0.01s and 0.05s.
    • Slab zTop adjusted from 125 km to 120 km.
    • Changed interpolation of the ΔC1 magnitude-scaling break term to log spectral periods and linear values; prior implementation was linear; change affects the following spectral periods: 0.4s, 0.6s (disabled), 0.75s, 1.5s, and 2.5s wherein the ΔC1 value has decreased by 0.01

    Implementation notes:

    • Treats all sites as forearc; no backarc term is considered.
    • zTop is interpreted as hypocentral depth and is only used for slab events; it is limited to 120 km, consistent with other subduction models.
    • Only the middle branch of the ΔC1 magnitude-scaling break term for interface events is considered; the ΔC1 term for slab events is fixed at -0.3.
    • Support for spectral period 0.01s is provided using the same coefficients as bounding periods PGA and 0.02s.
    • Support for spectral periods 0.03s is provided via interpolation of ground motion and sigma of adjacent periods.

    Reference: Abrahamson, N., Gregor, N., and Addo, K., 2016, BC Hydro ground motion prediction equations for subduction earthquakes: Earthquake Spectra, v. 32, n. 1, p. 23-44.

    doi: 10.1193/051712EQS188MR

    Reference: Addo, K., Abrahamson, N., and Youngs, R., (BC Hydro), 2012, Probabilistic seismic hazard analysis (PSHA) model—Ground motion characterization (GMC) model: Report E658, v. 3, November.

    Component: Geometric mean of two horizontal components

    Author:
    Peter Powers
    See Also:
    Gmm.BCHYDRO_12_INTERFACE, Gmm.BCHYDRO_12_SLAB, Gmm.BCHYDRO_12_INTERFACE_BASIN_AMP, Gmm.BCHYDRO_12_SLAB_BASIN_AMP
